mainWindow module¶

platform

Unix, Windows

synopsis

This is the main module. Run this file to start the GUI.

moduleauthor

Michael Eller <mbe9a@virginia.edu>

class mainWindow.Ui_MainWindow[source]¶

Bases: object

The graphical structure of Ui_MainWindow was generated by QtDesigner. The window contains a settings menu, LCD display, and a button to launch a live plot.

setupUi(MainWindow)[source]¶

This function initializes the window by altering the MainWindow object passed (by reference) to it.

Parameters

MainWindow – this must be of type PyQt5.QtWidgets.QMainWindow

retranslateUi(MainWindow)[source]¶

This function translates the GUI objects of this class to the passed MainWindow objcect, then sets the text of the various objects in the main window.

Parameters

MainWindow – this must be of type PyQt5.QtWidgets.QMainWindow

check_port()[source]¶

Checks to see if the user has set a port. If not, the user will not be able to start the live plot or LCD.

open_settings_filter()[source]¶

This function spawns an instance of windowFilterGUI.Ui_Dialog. This is triggered by clicking Menu > Settings > Window Filter.

open_settings_sample_rate()[source]¶

This function spawns an instance of sampRateGUI.Ui_Dialog. This is triggered by clicking Menu > Settings > Sample Rate.

open_settings_scale_axes()[source]¶

This function spawns an instance of scaleAxesGUI.Ui_Dialog. This is triggered by clicking Menu > Settings > Scale Axes.

open_settings_port()[source]¶

This function spawns an instance of portsGUI.Ui_Dialog. This is triggered by clicking Menu > Settings > Port Connection.

show_plot()[source]¶

This function spawns an instance of plotGUI.Ui_Dialog. It is triggered by the user clicking the large ‘Plot’ button.

toggle_timer()[source]¶

This function is triggered on every click of the check box. If the check box is enabled and the user has set the serial port, this function enables a timer that will update the LCD every 1s.

update_display()[source]¶

This function will execute on the 1s timer’s timeout. It will then request the most recent ADC value from the serial port and display the corrected value on the LCD.

Usage¶

import sys
from PyQt5 import QtWidgets
from mainWindow import Ui_MainWindow

app = QtWidgets.QApplication(sys.argv)
MainWindow = QtWidgets.QMainWindow()
ui = Ui_MainWindow()
ui.setupUi(MainWindow)
MainWindow.show()
sys.exit(app.exec_())
